This is an awesome game, works perfectly. If your trying to use xbox controller, use Xpadder with it. If your getting sound but no visual, tweak or update your codec pack (if installing K-lite use the "lots of stuff" setting in the drop down list. For .DLL problems normally you just need to update your graphics card drivers before you install the game. Thanks for this excellent & clean upload .BONE. I restarted my computer and went on to restart the game and change the grafics setting back to default but launching the application resulted in an instant "Failed to start" error provoking me to instantly uninstall this disaster... Ok,I solved evrything and for those who are asking how to change disc here is how:
Run game normaly,select Disc 1,than when it asks to change disck do this:
1. Press ALT+TAB and you should see white blank space
2. Than on that blank space select first tab like on normal GC emulator,when you selected first tab,select second line on that tab and now browsing window should open
3. Than from that navigate to C:\Resident Evil - Remake  
4.When you navigated to C:\Resident Evil - Remake   you will see ISO named R1B,open it and enyoj in DISC 2

This is great.  Its bringing me back man!  I've only experienced one irregular glitch so far.  That being a slight frame rate reduction in the mansion lobby. but only the camera angle facing the east wing double doors. other than that it works fantastically on my high end, late 2010 laptop.  there were a couple of glitches in the original gamecube copy as most of you probably know.  they were still there.  just wouldn't be the same game though without them.

Firstly, thanks on this fine release, didn't expect to work :)

The game is running pretty smooth in 1680*1050 with 4xAA and enabled filtering on Ati 4850 & Q6600 @3ghz. For joypad lovers, i'm not sure if it's possible to play it by controller, try xpadder, it might work.

And about savegames, when u use inkribbon in a game, in upper left screen should popup location of the save. Since i have dolpin emulator it saved it on virtual memory card which dolphin uses.

Enjoy
EDIT: just to say it works really fine with controller, using xpadder

The game works fine.For those people that dont know how to change to disc2,you have to alt-tab during the game and navigate to dolphin window,then open the first menu(file)and choose the second option.Menu might not be visible but it is there.You can also change some settings in the third menu,such as setting efb copies to texture instead of default ram,it improves performance greatly.

Resident Evil - Remake HAS STOPPED WORKING!?

Please help me any idea :(

Attention! For the ones who can't change disk even when alt tabbing: Go to C:Users"insert your user here"AppDataRoamingThinstallResident Evil - Remake%drive_C%Resident Evil - RemakeUserConfig 
and open the Dolphin file. Change the values to look like this - MainWindowPosX = 75
MainWindowPosY = 75
MainWindowWidth = 800
MainWindowHeight = 600
Language = 0
ShowToolbar = True

now you can alt tab and actually see the dolphin software
